name: Hilton Santo Domingo

reviews.text: Spent one night for a quick, quick business trip to Santo Domingo so my observations are limited. The hotel does not appear to be within walking distance of the colonial city and it also appears to be the farthest of the big chain hotels given that you pass the Sofitel, Jaragua (Renaissance), Melia and Intercontinental on your way in from the airport. I did see a Tony Roma's next door which looked as if it was in an outdoor mall so there may be some tourist action that I didn't see either on my way in or out.
reviews.title: Good business hotel in Santo Domingo

likes.disliked: — Seemed as bland as Santo Domingo itself

reviews.text: Notwithstanding, in talking to my clients, the Hilton is the best business hotel in the city. I concur, as I needed use of the business centre at 11 p.m. and it was open and staffed.
reviews.title: Really liked this hotel

reviews.text: Apart from the that, the hotel is clean and airy with an atrium-type lobby. The check-in staff were courteous and both that helped me spoke exceptional, almost accent-less English. The room (902) was typical Hilton standard room, very clean, good La Source products and nice view of the not too impressive Malecon and the apartment building next door. Room service was hit and miss. The club sandwich was good, but the fries were a little on the stale side and no salt provided.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: One big plus, at least for me, is that the hotel has smoking rooms. I understand the gripe from non-smokers, but I don't see the harm of having a few segregated rooms or a floor for smokers such as myself. Kudos to Hilton for that.
reviews.title: Very nice and clean place!

likes.disliked: — the price of the drinks at the bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't see much of Santo Domingo, but it appears that the colonial city is large and should be promoted more heavily than what it is. Having seen the Malecon in Panama City and other waterfront areas in San Juan, I was really disappointed with the one in Santo Domingo. Not that it's ugly or anything, but there's just nothing there and therefore, it's not particularly inviting. Unless I need to go for business, I don't foresee any trips to Santo Domingo in the future, but if I should go again, the Hilton would be a good choice.
reviews.title: Great hotel, not so great service!

reviews.text: I wanted to stay in the capitol and honestly this hotel was the newest and most convienent location. The entire hotel was modern and the view from the room was gorgeous. The staff members were accomodating and when I asked them where I could get a piece of traditional dominican birthday cake (because it was my birthday) they had the kitchen make me one..since there was no nearby bakery. The breakfast buffet was good but overpriced and yes the pool was small but so what...it was always empty. There weren't any worthy restaurants close to the hotel....but if you don't mind walking then you'll have a few options including a grocery store and a small strip mall. You can also take a short cab ride to el conde. But don't bother going into the so called mall next door (malecon) because it's just a bunch of ATM's. And last but not least try and eat at El Conuco which is a cheap cab ride or a long walk. The food was authentic and the staff was great. They even put on a show during dinner. If you are heading out to any of the bars/clubs make sure you get an early start because everything is over by 1am...even on the weekends.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel...good location...but nothing to rave about

description: The Hilton Santo Domingo is located on the southern side of the city, 31 kilometers (35 minutes) away from the Las Americas International Airport and 110 kilometers (120 minutes) away from La Romana International Airport. Situated near Santo Domingo’s major corporations, the downtown business sector. Hilton Santo Domingo is the perfect hotel for business and events.The Hilton Santo Domingo with 21 floors and panoramic elevators in the atrium is the tallest hotel in Santo Domingo and overlooks the tranquil waters of the Caribbean sea, with 3 bars and one restaurant. All guests can enjoy free internet WiFi at Vista Bar and Akwa Bar.
